title: Re: I've got some new hardware :D
content:
Well this brings up a point that's been bugging me ever since I upgraded my seven year old mouse a month ago. I bought a Logitech MX1000 - another laser-based mouse, but the scroll wheel on it is driving me crazy!

My old mouse used to do it occasionally (an early Logitech with a wheel) but this one does it about 90% of the time. When I move the wheel, I expect the screen to scroll one 'unit' for every 'click' the scroll wheel makes. If I move the wheel two clicks, I expect the screen to scroll two units.

Unfortunately the wheel seems misaligned, so that when I start pushing on the wheel it scrolls one unit, then when the wheel clicks it scrolls a second unit, then when I let go of the wheel it scrolls *back* one unit. This makes it extremely irritating to use, and something that I would've expected they'd fixed by now...

Is it just my mouse, or do yours all do this too?

title: Re: I've got some new hardware :D
content: I imagine it's a dodgy mouse - my Logitech never does this, and neither does my friend's (who also has a Logitech MX1000).
